title: VMware as a Service docs
introduction: IBM Cloud for VMware as a Service is an IBM Cloud offering that deploys a comprehensive portfolio of automated and on-demand services for VMware workloads to the cloud. Learn how to make the most of your VMware as a Service experience by using the docs.

tiles.title: Migrating virtual machines to VMware as a Service
tiles.description: The VMware Cloud Director Availability (VCDA) service is now available as a cost-effective solution to easily migrate your VMware vCenter Server or on-premises workloads to the VMware as a Service single-tenant consumption model. Use enterprise-level VCDA to migrate virtual machines over a secure public internet connection at no cost.

tiles.title: VMware as a Service Multitenant
tiles.description: This release announces the VMware as a Service Multitenant offering. VMware as a Service Multitenant provides a flexible, pay-per-use option to deploy virtual data centers on an IBM-managed Cloud Director site. You can get started quickly by selecting from on-demand or reserved pricing plans, and then add CPU, RAM, and storage as needed. Additionally, the VeeamÂ® Backup and Replication service is available for you to install to securely protect and provide a recovery option for your workloads.

tiles.title: SAP-certified provider virtual data centers
tiles.description: VMware as a Service now supports SAP workloads that use the new SAP bare metal server profiles. You can reliably run your mission-critical SAP workloads and scenarios on a scalable, compliant, and enterprise-proven VMware platform.
